subject: RE: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: Yeah, I had thought of that, but I was imagining a TestRunner-independent solution. Todd. ________________________________ From: Jeff Waltzer
messageBody:
Yeah, I had thought of that, but I was imagining a
TestRunner-independent solution.


Todd.


________________________________

From: Jeff Waltzer [mailto:jeffwaltzer@...]
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2005 5:33 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?



Perhaps you could write a TestRunner Decorator. Just wrap
whatever
TestRunner your are using with your own. Overide addError and
addFailure.to add in your logging?
